intro: Phyllanthus unioensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
